creatureList.name: Mighty Joe Young
creatureList.title: Mighty Joe Young
creatureList.description: Joe, the title character, is a tamed gorilla brought to Hollywood. Ray Harryhausen assisted his mentor Willis O'Brien (King Kong) on Mighty Joe Young and animated most of Mighty Joe Young's performance.

creatureList.name: Rhedosaur
creatureList.title: The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms
creatureList.description: A fictitious species of dinosaur, awakened from a 100,000 year hibernation in the Arctic Circle by an atom bomb test.

creatureList.name: It (giant octopus)
creatureList.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea
creatureList.description: A 200 foot long, radioactive, mutated Octopus that wreaks havoc on San Francisco.

creatureList.name: Brontosaur (The Animal World)
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'Engineered by nature in a freakish manner so that she can hardly support her weight in land,' as described in The Animal World.

creatureList.name: Allosaur (The Animal World)
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'Mortal enemy of the Bronty,' as described in The Animal World.

creatureList.name: Brontosaur Hatchling
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'The prehistoric sun incubates one of the few remaining Bronty eggs.'

creatureList.name: Stegosaur
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'A dinosaur of gentle nature, even though 20 feet long and 10 tons weight.'

creatureList.name: Sceraptosaur
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: This sceraptosaur battles with both a stegosaur and another sceraptosaur.

creatureList.name: Triceratops (The Animal World)
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'One of the species fated to disappear from the face of the Earth,' as narrated by The Animal World.

creatureList.name: Tyrannosaur
creatureList.title: The Animal World
creatureList.description: 'Deadly enemy of the Triceratops,' as narrated by The Animal World.

creatureList.name: Flying Saucers
creatureList.title: Earth vs. the Flying Saucers
creatureList.description: Saucers soar, land, battle, and smash buildings into stop-motion animated rubble.

creatureList.name: Spaceship
creatureList.title: Twenty Million Miles to Earth
creatureList.description: The crash-landing of the first Venus expedition on its return trip.

creatureList.name: Ymir
creatureList.title: Twenty Million Miles to Earth
creatureList.description: Never named in the film, the Ymir is a native of Venus. Returned to Earth as an egg, the Ymir rapidly grows to monstrous proportions in Earth's atmosphere and runs amok.

creatureList.name: Elephant (Twenty Million Miles to Earth)
creatureList.title: Twenty Million Miles to Earth
creatureList.description: The Ymir tangles with this elephant on the streets of Rome after escaping from captivity at the zoo.

creatureList.name: Cyclops
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Mr. Harryhausen imagined the mythical cyclops as a goat-legged, horned, wild creature. Two cyclopses appear in the film: The first is defeated by Sinbad, and the second is killed by the fire-breathing dragon that guards Zokora's cave.

creatureList.name: Serpent Woman
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Princess Parissa's waiting woman Sadi, transformed into a dancing serpent woman by Zokora's magic.

creatureList.name: Roc Hatchling
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Princess Parissa's waiting woman Sadi, transformed into a dancing serpent woman by Zokora's magic.

creatureList.name: Roc
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Payback for the slaugter of her Roc hatchling.

creatureList.name: Skeleton
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Brought to life by Zokora's magic to steal a magic lamp, this skeleton swordsman fights Sinbad in Zokora's cave.

creatureList.name: Dragon
creatureList.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Guards the cavern entrance to Zokora's liar, slays a cyclops, and attacks Sinbad's crew before being slain by giant crossbow.

creatureList.name: Squirrel
creatureList.title: The 3 Worlds of Gulliver
creatureList.description: Lost in Brodbdingnag, a land of giants, the newlywed Gullivers are menaced by a giant squirrel.

creatureList.name: Crocodile
creatureList.title: The 3 Worlds of Gulliver
creatureList.description: The king of Brobdingnag forces Gulliver to battle his 'miniature' crocodile in a fight to the death.

creatureList.name: Crab
creatureList.title: Mysterious Island
creatureList.description: Attacks the castaways on Mysterious Island. After the battle, the castaways cook the defeated crab in a convenient hot spring.

creatureList.name: Phororhacos
creatureList.title: Mysterious Island
creatureList.description: A giant, scrawny, prehistoric bird that threatens to trample the castaways of Mysterious Island.

creatureList.name: Cephalopod
creatureList.title: Mysterious Island
creatureList.description: The nautiloid cephalopod is a gigantic prehistoric mollusc. The cephalopod attacks Captian Nemo's diving crew as they attempt to raise a sunken pirate ship.

creatureList.name: Bee
creatureList.title: Mysterious Island
creatureList.description: This bee drives two members of the Mysterious Island party into its giant honeycomb and seals them in with beeswax.

creatureList.name: Talos
creatureList.title: Jason and the Argonauts
creatureList.description: Massive statue on the Isle of Bronze who guards over a treasure chamber of the gods. Talos comes to life when Hercules steals from its treasure.

creatureList.name: Harpies
creatureList.title: Jason and the Argonauts
creatureList.description: Two harpies are assigned by Zeus to torment the blind prophet Phinneas for abusing his power of prophecy. Phinneas agrees to help Jason in exchange for the harpies' capture.

creatureList.name: Hydra
creatureList.title: Jason and the Argonauts
creatureList.description: Jason slays the mythical Hydra to steal the Golden Fleece. The Hydra comes from a different myth (the twelve labors of Hercules), and appears in Jason and the Argonauts short two heads (the Greek myth had nine).

creatureList.name: Skeletons
creatureList.title: Jason and the Argonauts
creatureList.description: Seven 'Children of the Hydra's Teeth' fight with Jason and two of his crew. Four are defeated in swordfights, and three plunge to their deaths following Jason off a cliff into the sea.

creatureList.name: Moonship
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: A hypothetical United Nations moonship service module lands on the moon's surface.

creatureList.name: Space Sphere
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: A Victorian era spacecraft, patterned after a diving bell and covered with railroad bumpers, powered by Professor Cavor's anti-gravity paint.

creatureList.name: Moon Cow
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: Both a moon cow and moon bull appear (both are the same stop-motion puppet), each a gigantic centipede-like beast with fierce mandibles and bad tempters.

creatureList.name: Kate Calendar's Skeleton
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: Kate Calendar is observed in an X-ray observation chamber by the Selenites.

creatureList.name: Selenite
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: Insect-like inhabitants of the interior of the moon (most appearances of the Selenites were costumed actors).

creatureList.name: Grand Lunar
creatureList.title: First Men in the Moon
creatureList.description: The leader of the Selenites, encased in a crystal sphere. The Grand Lunar is sentient, and interrogates Professor Cavor.

creatureList.name: Brontosaur (One Million Years B.C.)
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: This Brontosaur makes a brief appearance as Tumak wanders the wasteland after being expelled from his tribe.

creatureList.name: Archelon
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: A giant prehistoric turtle menaces the Shell people, who drive it into the sea.

creatureList.name: Allosaur (One Million Years B.C.)
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: Attacks the peaceful fishing village of the Shell people, but is impaled and killed by Tumak in a ferocious battle.

creatureList.name: Triceratops (One Million Years B.C.)
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: Gives chase to Tumak and Loana when they strike out on their own.

creatureList.name: Ceratosaur
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: Attacks a Triceratops during Tumak and Lona's journey. In the chaos, Tumak and Lona are separated.

creatureList.name: Pterodactyl
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: A Pterodactyl that suddenly drops from the sky and flies off with Lona in its talons.

creatureList.name: Rhamphorhynchus
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: A flying reptile that attacks and kills the Pterodactyl to steal Lona.

creatureList.name: Pterodactyl Hatchlings
creatureList.title: One Million Years B.C.
creatureList.description: The mother Pterodactyl attempts to feed Lona to her ravenous offspring before being attacked by a Rhamphorhynchus.

creatureList.name: Horse
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: A brief animation of T.J. performing a stunt on her horse: Diving from a tower into a water tub.

creatureList.name: Eohippus
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: Named 'El Diablo' by its captors, Eohippus is a miniature prehistoric horse. Its escape leads to the discovery of Gwangi.

creatureList.name: Pteranodon
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: Attacks Lope when he, Professor Bromley, and the cowboys first enter the forbidden valley.

creatureList.name: Ornithomimus
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: A small dinosaur chased by cowboys while searching for El Diablo in the Forbidden Valley before being captured & consumed by Gwangi.

creatureList.name: Gwangi
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: The title character of Gwangi is an Allosaur from the Forbidden Valley, an isolated spot where prehistoric life still flourishes. Gwangi is captured by a travelling Wild West show, but escapes and wreaks havoc.

creatureList.name: Styrathosaur
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: Attacks Gwangi while Professor Brombely watches, and later interferes during the lasso-ing of Gwangi.

creatureList.name: Elephant (The Valley of Gwangi)
creatureList.title: The Valley of Gwangi
creatureList.description: This performing elephant panicks and is slain by Gwangi after escaping from its cage.

creatureList.name: Homonicus
creatureList.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: A small humanoid, bat-winged creature who serves as an extension of Prince Koura's eyes and ears. The Homonicus is spontaneously generated from blood and sorcery.

creatureList.name: Figurehead
creatureList.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: The figurehead of Sinbad's ship, brought to life by Prince Koura's magic to steal Sinbad's navigation charts.

creatureList.name: Kali
creatureList.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Six-armed statue of the god worshiped by the Lemurians. The statue comes to life with a potion from Prince Koura, and fights Sinbad's entire crew with a sword in each hand.

creatureList.name: Centaur
creatureList.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: 'God of the Single Eye,' who resides in a pit leading to the Fountain of Destiny. The centaur represents the powers of evil, and is defeated by Sinbad with the aid of the Griffin in the film's climax.

creatureList.name: Griffin
creatureList.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
creatureList.description: Representing the powers of good, the Griffin battles the Centaur to defend Sinbad.

creatureList.name: Ghouls
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: Three torch-wielding ghouls are summoned by Queen Zenobia to kill Sinbad and his crew. They are defeated by Sinbad's quick-thinking action when he crushes them under a pile of timbers.

creatureList.name: Baboon
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: Queen Zenobia puts a curse upon the future Caliph, Prince Kassim, turning him into a Baboon. Sinbad transports Prince Kassim to the land of Hyberboria to restore him.

creatureList.name: Minoton
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: A golden mechanical Minotaur created by Queen Zenobia for muscle in her pursuit of Sinbad.

creatureList.name: Hornet
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: After miniaturizing herself to spy on Sinbad, Queen Zenobia's restoring potion is consumed by a hornet while Melanthius interrogates her.

creatureList.name: Walrus
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: Named Walrus Giganticus by Melanthius, this giant beast attacks Sinbad's crew as they trek across the ice to Hyberboria.

creatureList.name: Troglodyte
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: Encountered by Sinbad's crew in Hyberboria. Melanthius identifies the Troglodyte as an ancestor of humans, and it accompanies Sinbad's crew to the shrine where Prince Kassim can be restored.

creatureList.name: Guardian of the Shrine
creatureList.title: Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
creatureList.description: A Sabre-toothed cat, encased in ice and later possessed by Zenobia to kill Sinbad after losing her son in the Shrine. The Guardian does battle with — and defeats — the Troglodyte, but is later killed by Sinbad.

creatureList.name: Vulture
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: Carries Princess Andromeda's spirit away to Calibos, where she is given a new riddle to ask potential suitors. (The penalty for guessing the wrong answer is death by burning at the stake.)

creatureList.name: Pegasus
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: The last of the winged horses. Perseus captures Pegasus to follow the Giant Vulture that abducts Princess Andromeda. The airborne Pegasus animations were accomplished by Jim Danforth.

creatureList.name: Calibos
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: Deformed by Zeus as punishment Calibos' unrequited love for Princess Andromeda drives him mad. In dialog scenes, Calibos is played by actor Neil McCarthy.

creatureList.name: Bubo
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: A mechanical owl created by Haephestus as a replacement gift for Perseus after he loses his helmet of invisibility in Calibos' swamp. Most shots of Bubo were animated by Steve Archer.

creatureList.name: Dioskilos
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: The two-headed dog which guards the entrance to Medusa's lair on the Isle of the Dead. Dioskilos animation was accomplished by Steve Archer and Jim Danforth.

creatureList.name: Medusa
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: The mythical serpentine woman whose gaze turns men into stone. Perseus must obtain her head so that he can defeat the Kraken and save Princess Andromeda.

creatureList.name: Scorpions
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: Three giant scorpions are spawned from Medusa's dripping blood after Calibos punctures the bag containing her decapitated head.

creatureList.name: Kraken
creatureList.title: Clash of the Titans
creatureList.description: The last of the Titans. Goddess Theta demands that Princess Andromeda be sacrificed to the Kraken, claiming offense when Princess Andromeda's beauty is compared to her own.

movieList.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea
Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger
